name: Added Sugar
context_notes: Risk increases with frequent and high intake
typical_role: Enhances sweetness and balances acidic/bitter flavours
consumer_relevance: Common concern in packaged foods due to frequent intake patterns

name: High Fructose Corn Syrup
context_notes: Risk increases with frequent and high intake
typical_role: Provides sweetness in liquid and processed foods
consumer_relevance: Often highlighted as a marker of highly processed foods

name: Glucose Syrup
context_notes: Risk increases with frequent and high intake
typical_role: Adds sweetness and improves texture in processed foods
consumer_relevance: Contributes to rapid sugar intake in processed products

name: Aspartame
context_notes: Generally considered safe with recommended limits; concerns are more related to frequent and high intake
typical_role: Adds sweetness with little to no calories
consumer_relevance: Commonly found in diet and low-calorie products

name: Sucralose
context_notes: Generally safe with recommended limits; concerns are more related to frequent intake
typical_role: Provides sweetness without added calories
consumer_relevance: Used in sugar-free and low-calorie products

name: Palm Oil
context_notes: Health impact depends on overall diet and frequency of consumption
typical_role: Provides stability, texture, and longer shelf life in processed foods
consumer_relevance: Often used in processed products and associated with higher saturated fat content

name: Soybean Oil
context_notes: Health impact depends on overall dietary fat balance and frequency of consumption
typical_role: Used as a cooking and processing oil because of its neutral taste
consumer_relevance: Common source of dietary fat in packaged and fried foods

name: Sunflower Oil
context_notes: Health impact depends on type of sunflower oil and overall dietary fat balance
typical_role: Used as a cooking, frying, and food processing due to its neutral taste and high heat tolerance
consumer_relevance: Most commonly used oil in processed and fried foods

name: Butter
context_notes: Health relevance depends on portion size; occasional use differs from frequent intake
typical_role: Adds flavor and richness to foods
consumer_relevance: Natural fat source commonly used for taste and cooking

name: Hydrogenated Oil
context_notes: Concerns are higher with frequent consumption due to its high processing methods and fat composion
typical_role: Improves shelf life and texture in foods
consumer_relevance: Often used in highly processed foods as a stability and cost-effective fat source

name: Refined Wheat Flour (Maida)
context_notes: Frequent consumption may displace whole grains and fibers; effects depend on portion size and dietary balance
typical_role: Provides soft texture and structure in baked goods
consumer_relevance: Common base ingredient in many refined and processed foods

name: Corn Starch
context_notes: Quickly digestable carbohydrate; impact depends on quantity
typical_role: Thickens sauces and improves texture
consumer_relevance: Adds carbohydrates without significant nutitional value

name: Rice Flour
context_notes: Effects depend on refinement level and overall dietary pattern
typical_role: Used for structure and texture in baked and gluten-free foods
consumer_relevance: Common alternative to flour in processed and gluten-free products

name: Tapioca Starch
context_notes: Primarily a refined carbohydrate; relevance increases with frequent consumption
typical_role: Improves chewiness and thickens food products
consumer_relevance: Used to modify texture in processed foods with minimal nutitional value

name: Emulsifier (E471)
context_notes: Concerns mainly relate to frequent intake of highly processed foods rather than occasional use
typical_role: Helps blend fats and water and improves texture
consumer_relevance: Signals a higher level of food processing

name: Emulsifier (E472)
context_notes: Generally considered safe in small amounts; relevance increases with frequent consumption of processed foods
typical_role: Improves stability and consistency of processed foods
consumer_relevance: Often used as a marker of processed food formulation

name: Stabilizer
context_notes: Health relevance is mainly linked to cumulative exposure from multiple processed foods
typical_role: Maintains texture and prevents separation
consumer_relevance: Indicates formulation designed for shelf stability

name: Thickener
context_notes: Typically safe in small amounts; relevance increases with frequent consumption of processed foods
typical_role: Increases viscosity and improves mouthfeel
consumer_relevance: Used to modify texture rather than add nutrition

name: Preservative
context_notes: Generally safe within regulated limits; cumulative intake is more relevant than single exposure
typical_role: Extends shelf life by preventing spoilage
consumer_relevance: Common in packaged foods designed for long storage

name: Antioxidant
context_notes: Used to prevent oxidation; health relevance depends on type and frequency of intake
typical_role: Prevents rancidity and preserves freshness
consumer_relevance: Supports shelf life rather than nutritional value

name: Anti-caking Agent
context_notes: Typically used in very small amounts; relevance mainly relates to frequent processed food intake
typical_role: Prevents clumping and improves flow of powdered ingredients
consumer_relevance: Functional ingredient indicating processed formulation

name: Artificial Flavor
context_notes: Generally used in small amounts; relevance increases with frequent intake of highly processed foods
typical_role: Adds or enhances flavor without contributing nutrition
consumer_relevance: Signals heavy flavor engineering in processed foods

name: Natural Flavor
context_notes: Derived from natural sources but still processed; impact depends on overall diet quality
typical_role: Enhances flavor using extracts from natural sources
consumer_relevance: Often perceived as healthier but still indicates processing

name: Flavor Enhancer (MSG / E621)
context_notes: Generally considered safe; some individuals report sensitivity, especially with frequent intake
typical_role: Enhances savory taste and palatability
consumer_relevance: Common in savory processed foods to increase taste appeal

name: Yeast Extract
context_notes: Used for savory flavor; relevance depends on frequency and quantity consumed
typical_role: Provides umami flavor naturally
consumer_relevance: Often used as an alternative to added flavor enhancers

name: Artificial Color
context_notes: Generally safe within limits; concerns relate to frequent intake from multiple sources
typical_role: Improves or standardizes product appearance
consumer_relevance: Purely aesthetic ingredient indicating high processing

name: Food Coloring
context_notes: Health relevance mainly relates to cumulative exposure over time
typical_role: Adds or restores color to food products
consumer_relevance: Used for visual appeal rather than nutrition

name: Salt
context_notes: Health relevance depends on total daily intake across foods
typical_role: Enhances flavor and acts as a preservative
consumer_relevance: Major contributor to sodium intake in packaged foods

name: Citric Acid
context_notes: Generally safe; may cause discomfort for sensitive individuals in large amounts
typical_role: Provides acidity and flavor balance
consumer_relevance: Common additive for taste and preservation

name: Milk Solids
context_notes: Relevance mainly applies to individuals sensitive to dairy components
typical_role: Adds creaminess and dairy flavor
consumer_relevance: Important for people monitoring dairy intake

name: Cocoa Powder
context_notes: Contains naturally occurring stimulants; relevance depends on portion size
typical_role: Provides chocolate flavor and color
consumer_relevance: Contributes flavor rather than significant nutrition in processed foods

name: Raising Agent
context_notes: Used in small quantities; relevance mainly tied to processed food intake frequency
typical_role: Helps baked goods rise and improve texture
consumer_relevance: Functional ingredient indicating baked or processed formulation

name: Baking Soda
context_notes: Contributes to sodium intake when used frequently in baked foods
typical_role: Acts as a leavening agent in baking
consumer_relevance: Hidden source of sodium in baked products
